title: Augusta County: Mary Anna Sibert to Mr. and Mrs. Lorenzo Sibert, December, 1862
summary: Mary Anna Sibert writes her parents to report the return of her uncle from imprisonment as a traitor to the cause. She describes his escape, denies his alleged Union sentiments, and discusses a new military invention.
keywords: Church/Religious Activity, Family, Home Front, Patriotism, Prisons/Prisoners, Women, American Civil War
